project.teaser: BIOTRANSFORM provides European policymakers with an adequate assessment and policy development framework, knowledge base and expert support ecosystem to accelerate the transition from linear fossil-based systems to circular bio-based systems. It is therefore operating at the...
project.objective: BIOTRANSFORM provides European policymakers with an adequate assessment and policy development framework, knowledge base and expert support ecosystem to accelerate the transition from linear fossil-based systems to circular bio-based systems. It is therefore operating at the interface between the circular economy and the bioeconomy transitions. In this way, BIOTRANSFORM equips policymakers with the tools to set informed priorities that serve environmental, economic, and social goals, being actionable, future-proof, and align with supply-and-demand trends in related industries and value chains. BIOTRANSFORM’s “assessment package” will be tested by and provided for European policymakers, which will include 3 complementary tools: (i) resource flow analysis tool including circular innovations, (ii) a cutting-edge quick environmental, social and economic assessment tool, and (iii) a logistics management tool. To achieve this, BIOTRANSFORM develops and tests its framework to establish and roll out circular bio-based systems by applying a multi-actor approach around 6 regional cases: Andalusia (Spain), Northern Burgenland (Austria), Western Macedonia (Greece), Finland, Charles Spa Region (Czech Repulic) and North Rhine-Westphalia (Germany). These regional case studies represent several important industries and scenarios for Europe such as: forestry, agri-food, lake ecosystems, lignite and minerals, and chemicals. Action roadmaps will consider specific regional available resources and infrastructures, conversion pathways, logistics, current policies, strategies, and access to finance. In other words, BIOTRANSFORM builds on the concept of regenerative bioeconomy value cycles by tapping into what is there already and connecting the dots. In this concept, carbon is stored and nutrients are recovered. This concept shall be upscaled and replicated to many further European regions to achieve Europe's ambitious goals.
project.title: Circular BIOeconomy TRANSFORMation for regions by enabling resource and governance networks
project.keywords: circular bioeconomy, transition, policymakers, assessment tools, bioeconomy value cycles, bio-cascading, connected biorefineries, green transition, digitalisation

result.title: Exploitation and Sustainability Plan – final version
result.description: The updated version of D5.4 defining our strategy and methodology with respect to innovation and IPR management. The report will include the final plans and provisions for paving and treading the way towards the post-project exploitation and sustainability of the project’s assets.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan – final version
result.description: The updated version of D5.1 fine-tuning as appropriate the strategy, plan and actions undertaken under Task 5.1 with respect to dissemination and communication. The report will also present the results of the dissemination and communication activities of the project at the time as well as update, if necessary, the targets to be met by them for the remainder of the project.

result.title: Management and Quality Plan
result.description: Plan for scheduling and monitoring of project activities. This deliverable will be created in Task 6.1 and will include the planned quality insurance procedures including the peer review procedure of all deliverables, the project progress monitoring procedure, and the possible problem and risk mitigation planning, which is not covered by the GA or the CA.

result.title: Individual report on each subsystem assessment methodology (environmental, economic, socio-cultural)
result.description: Outcomes from the environmental, economic and socio-cultural impact assessments of our proposed transformation processes. The environmental impact assessment will derive from Task 2.2, the economic assessment from Task 2.3, and the socio-cultural assessment from Task 2.4.

result.title: Policy brief about barriers and opportunities for the transition from linear fossil-based to a circular bioeconomy
result.description: This first policy brief will list the barriers and opportunities for the transition toward a circular bio-based economy identified in T1.1, 1.2, and 3.1. The policy brief itself will be created in Task 4.4.

result.title: Data Management Plan - initial version
result.description: A report produced under Task 6.2. The report will outline the data to be collected / generated during the project as well as the data management methodology and plan to be followed across their life cycle in order to ensure their sound and FAIR management.

result.title: Database of suitable circular bioeconomy solutions
result.description: This database will be compiled in Task 1.3 and will include >40 circular bioeconomy solutions, which are suitable for our pilot areas and sectors. For these entries, the Circular Cities & Regions Initiative (CCRI) will also be contacted to either directly use their templates and feed into the planned CCRI database and/or will be hosted by the BIOTRANSFORM project website in an easily understandable and structured format.

result.title: Report on the different pathway analysis and selection of optimal transition pathway from linear fossil-based to a circular bioeconomy
result.description: Transition pathway analysis description with regional actors. The key parameters for the demo regions will be consolidated in Task 3.1 and stakeholder intervention and feedback taken in Task 3.2.

result.title: Data Management Plan - final version
result.description: The updated and final version of the Data Management Plan. This final version will build upon and update D6.2 to reflect any newly identified data that were collected / generated during the project as well as any changes in data previously identified and/or the methodology and plans of BIOTRANSFORM for sound and FAIR data management.

result.title: Exploitation and Sustainability Plan – initial version
result.description: A report produced under Task 5.2 defining our strategy and methodology with respect to innovation and IPR management. The report will also outline plans and provisions for paving the way towards the post-project exploitation and sustainability of our assets.

result.title: Final joint policy brief for a transition from linear fossil-based to a circular bioeconomy
result.description: Incorporating inputs and findings of the other grant(s) funded within this topic. It will present key policy recommendations to be implemented at European or national level to overcome the barriers and take advantage of the opportunities identified in D4.2.

result.title: Transition guideline overview from linear fossil-based to a circular bioeconomy for general use
result.description: Easily understandable visualised guideline for a circular bioeconomy transition of regions developed in Task 3.4. This guideline will be designed as brochure.

result.title: Report on the framework for assessment and methodology applied in the impact tool
result.description: Framework for the planned assessment and methodology applied in the BIOTRANSFORM assessment tool carried out in Task 2.1

result.title: Report on limits of the linear fossil economies
result.description: Baseline report on environment, economic & social limits of linear fossil-based economies exemplifying our 6 case-study regions. The desk research and main information will be done in Task 1.1. The stakeholder interviews from Task 1.5 will also be considered.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan – initial version
result.description: A report elaborating on the strategy, plan, and actions to be undertaken under Task 5.1 with respect to dissemination and communication. The report will also include specific targets to be met by the respective activities of the project throughout its course.

result.title: Literature review comparing impact assessment methodologies for linear fossil and circular bio-based economies
result.description: This deliverable will present the results from Task 1.4 by providing an overview of existing impact assessment methodologies and key ideas to be considered for shaping BIOTRANSFORM’s assessment package.

result.title: Transition roadmaps from linear fossil-based to a circular bioeconomy of our case-studies
result.description: Roadmaps with milestones and circular economy guides for each case-study region including rural-urban-industrial symbiosis schemes presented as guide / action plan. This deliverable will be a result of Task 3.3.

result.title: Methodology on governance and financing means for a transition from linear fossil-based to a circular bioeconomy
result.description: This report will consist of a practical guideline targeting regional authorities and listing key principles and recommendation for a regional governance toward a circular bio-based economy, as well as how to fund and finance this transition. It will include general recommendations and short presentations of actual practices identified in WP1, 2, and 3. Possible governance mechanisms will be backchecked with multi-project working groups in Task 4.1. The financing part will derive from Task 4.2 and the major descriptions of mechanisms and governance will be developed in Task 4.3.

result.title: Report on current status of development of EU regional circular bioeconomies
result.description: Baseline report on current circular bioeconomy, measurement indicators, assessment of technologies & solutions. The desk research and main information will be done in Task 1.2. The stakeholder interviews from Task 1.5 will also be considered.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - BIOTRANSFORM (Circular BIOeconomy TRANSFORMation for regions by enabling resource and governance networks)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: Context:In the wake of pressing global challenges such as climate change, resource depletion, and biodiversity loss, there is an urgent need to transition from linear, fossil-based economies to more sustainable, resilient, and circular bio-based economies. The European Union...

webItem.alternativeText: A general flow of resources in a circular bioeconomy system
The connected biorefinery scheme foresees valorisation of all resources at different scales

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
